fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Proprietary file format for streaming audio. Provides for four different codecs; see Relationships to Other Formats, below.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: proprietary file format for streaming audio.

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: RealAudio lossless codec, not separately documented
RealAudio multichannel codec, not separately documented

fdd:localUse.fdd:experience: The Library of Congress has a small amount of RealAudio files in its collections.
fdd:localUse.fdd:preference: See the Library of Congress Recommended Formats Statement for format preferences for audio works.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Proprietary format with little public documentation, although licenses for certain classes of developers may provide access to source code.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Widely adopted for streaming web content and other online applications, starting in the mid-1990s. As of March 2012, the Wikipedia page for RealAudio notes that although used widely by radio stations for streaming audio in the past, use has become less common in recent years. In particular, the BBC dropped use from its primary website in 2009, and from the BBC World Service in 2011.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:licensingAndPatents: Licensing for RealAudio and RealVideo, and for related production and delivery tools, is described at https://helixcommunity.org/content/licenses, an entity of RealNetworks, Inc. Licensing includes open source and research and development arrangements that provide access to the source code for the codecs.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Depends upon algorithms and tools to read; will require sophistication and documentation to build tools.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:selfDocumentation: Embedded bibliographic or descriptive metadata is included in online examples, e.g., title, artist, genre. This writer could not find documentation as of April 2004; RealAudio may share metadata structure with RealVideo.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:externalDependencies: Playback of surround sound requires multiple loudspeakers.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:techProtection: RealAudio likely to share technical protection devices with RealVideo.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:beyondVideo: A sequence of Web pages can be synchronized for display with the playback of streaming media in a RealMedia player when HTML-page URLs are embedded in a RealMedia clip.

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: For RealMedia file. See HomeRecording.com for discussion of audio-only .rm vs .ra files.
Note that streaming applications require an associated ram (RealMedia Metafile) file.

fdd:internetMediaType.fdd:note: From RealNetworks web page; this MIME type was associated with extension rm. No examples found in IANA MIME Media Types.
From RealNetworks web page; this MIME type was associated with extension ra and ram. No examples found in IANA MIME Media Types.

fdd:magicNumbers.fdd:note: From Gary Kessler's File Signatures Table.

fdd:values.fdd:note: PRONOM has no corresponding entry as of July 2022.
See https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q201093.Note that Wikidata does not specify versions.

fdd:urlGroup.fdd:intro: No formal specification is available. See Useful References below for sources that provide some technical information.

fdd:urlReference.comment: Promotional description of RealAudio 10 from RealNetworks, Inc. No longer online at Real. Link is to Wayback machine at Internet Archive.

Helix was the professional product line from Real Networks for producing and delivering streaming video. The Helix product line is no longer sold. The library (no longer online) provided access to product manuals, including an archive for non-current product versions. Link is now via Wayback machine at Internet Archive.

fdd:urlReference.tag: RealAudio Codec Reference (Appendix A of Helix Producer User's Guide)
fdd:urlReference.comment: Discussion of codecs for RealAudio, dated 2002, apparently for version 8. Some of this information may be valid for RealAudio codecs.
Official IANA page; RealMedia not listed.
For file extensions and magic numbers.
Information in Wikidata about RealAudio. Wikidata Title ID: Q201093.
